metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Image Shapes
With CSS it is easy to shape (clip) images to circles, ellipses and polygons.
content.html: With CSS it is easy to shape (clip) images to circles, ellipses and polygons.

content.text: The CSS clip-path Property
The clip-path property lets you clip an element to a basic shape.
content.html: The clip-path property lets you clip an element to a basic shape.

content.text: The CSS circle() Function
The circle() function defines a circle with a radius and a position.
content.html: The circle() function defines a circle with a radius and a position.

content.text: The circle() function is used within the clip-path property.
content.html: The circle() function is used within the clip-path property.

content.text: Here we clip an image to a circle with 50% radius:
content.html: Here we clip an image to a circle with 50% radius:

content.code_html:
img {
  clip-path: circle(50%);
}

content.text: We can also specify the center of the circle. This can be a length or percentage value. It can also be a value such as left, right, top, or bottom. The default value is center.
content.html: We can also specify the center of the circle. This can be a length or percentage value. It can also be a value such as left, right, top, or bottom. The default value is center.

content.text: Here we clip an image to a circle with 50% radius and position the center of the circle to the right:
content.html: Here we clip an image to a circle with 50% radius and position the center of the circle to the right:

content.code_html:
img {
  clip-path: circle(50% at right);
}

content.text: The CSS shape-outside Property
The shape-outside property lets you define a shape for the wrapping of the inline content.
content.html: The shape-outside property lets you define a shape for the wrapping of the inline content.

content.text: The circle() function is also used within the shape-outside property.
content.html: The circle() function is also used within the shape-outside property.

content.text: Here we clip an image to a circle with 40% radius, and set the shape-outside to a circle with 45% radius (to shape the text):
content.html: Here we clip an image to a circle with 40% radius, and set the shape-outside to a circle with 45% radius (to shape the text):

  shape-outside: circle(45%);}

content.text: The CSS ellipse() Function
The ellipse() function defines an ellipse with two radii x and y.
content.html: The ellipse() function defines an ellipse with two radii x and y.

content.text: The ellipse() function is used within the clip-path property and the shape-outside property.
content.html: The ellipse() function is used within the clip-path property and the shape-outside property.

content.text: Here we clip an image to an ellipse with 50% radius x and 35% radius y:
content.html: Here we clip an image to an ellipse with 50% radius x and 35% radius y:

content.code_html:
img {
  clip-path: ellipse(50% 35%);
}

content.text: We can also specify the center of the ellipse. This can be a length or percentage value. It can also be a value such as left, right, top, or bottom. The default value is center.
content.html: We can also specify the center of the ellipse. This can be a length or percentage value. It can also be a value such as left, right, top, or bottom. The default value is center.

content.text: Here we clip an image to an ellipse with 50% radius x and 35% radius y, and position the center of the ellipse to the right:
content.html: Here we clip an image to an ellipse with 50% radius x and 35% radius y, and position the center of the ellipse to the right:

content.code_html:
img {
  clip-path: ellipse(50% 35% at right);
}

content.text: The shape-outside Property and ellipse()
Here we clip an image to an ellipse with 40% radius x and 50% radius y, and set the shape-outside to an ellipse with 45% radius x and 50% radius y (to shape the text):
content.html: Here we clip an image to an ellipse with 40% radius x and 50% radius y, and set the shape-outside to an ellipse with 45% radius x and 50% radius y (to shape the text):

content.text: The CSS polygon() Function
The polygon() function defines a polygon.
content.html: The polygon() function defines a polygon.

content.text: The polygon() function contains points that define the polygon. This can be a length or percentage value. Each point is a pair of x and y coordinates. 0 0 defines the left top corner and 100% 100% defines the right bottom corner.
content.html: The polygon() function contains points that define the polygon. This can be a length or percentage value. Each point is a pair of x and y coordinates. 0 0 defines the left top corner and 100% 100% defines the right bottom corner.

content.text: The polygon() function is used within the clip-path property and the shape-outside property.
content.html: The polygon() function is used within the clip-path property and the shape-outside property.

content.text: Here we clip an image to a polygon:
content.html: Here we clip an image to a polygon:

content.code_html:
img {
  clip-path: polygon(50% 0%, 100% 50%, 50% 100%, 0% 50%);
}

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which CSS property is used to clip an image into specific shapes?
content.html: Which CSS property is used to clip an image into specific shapes?

metadata.question: Which CSS property is used to clip an image into specific shapes?

content.question: Which CSS property is used to clip an image into specific shapes?

content.text: CSS Properties and Functions
The following table lists the CSS properties and functions used in this chapter:
content.html: The following table lists the CSS properties and functions used in this chapter:

content.code_html:
Property/Function Description
clip-path Lets you clip an element to a basic shape or to an SVG source
shape-outside Lets you define a shape for the wrapping of the inline content
circle() Defines a circle with a radius and a position
ellipse() Defines an ellipse with two radii x and y
polygon() Defines a polygon
